thread.title: Honor 6X with dual rear cameras and 3,340mAh battery lands in India, yours for Rs 12,999
thread.title_full: Honor 6X with dual rear cameras and 3,340mAh battery lands in India, yours for Rs 12,999

title: Honor 6X with dual rear cameras and 3,340mAh battery lands in India, yours for Rs 12,999
text:
Honor 6X with dual rear cameras and 3,340mAh battery lands in India,... Honor 6X with dual rear cameras and 3,340mAh battery lands in India, yours for Rs 12,999 By January 24, 2017 “The Honor 6X is a high-end phablet with 12MP + 2MP rear cameras and 3,340mAh battery” 
Huawei’s sub-brand Honor has launched its latest smartphone, the Honor 6X in India. The Honor 6X comes as a successor to the Honor 5X ( review ) , which was released in India in February last year. The Honor 6X is a high-end phablet featuring dual cameras, a premium metal unibody design and a fingerprint sensor. 
The Honor 6X ( first impressions ) features a 12-megapixel primary snapper at the back, mated to a 2-megapixel secondary shooter, an LED flash, 6P lens and phase detection autofocus. For selfies, the handset gets an 8-megapixel front-facing snapper. The phone sports a 5.5-inch full HD 2.5D curved glass IPS screen. An octa-core Kirin 655 SoC handles the performance working in tandem with 3GB RAM and Mali T832-MP2 graphics. 
The Honor 6X comes with 32GB of internal memory, which is further expandable via a microSD card. Software-wise, the device boots Android 6.0 Marshmallow with EMUI 4.1 custom UI on top. The connectivity features include 4G, VoLTE, hybrid dual-SIM slots, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth 4.1 and GPS. A 3,340mAh battery with fast charging capabilities keeps the show running. 
The Honor 6X has been priced at Rs 12,999, and will be available exclusively on Amazon India. You can register on the e-tailer to get a notification when the sale starts later today. Facebook Comments
